titlestmt.titleproper: Joshua Francis Fisher historical notes undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

scopecontent.p: Reminiscences and transcripts, undated, of family letters by Joshua Francis Fisher, including "The Harrison Papers," a partial biography of George Harrison, Fisher's uncle, with much social history of Philadelphia; Tench Tilghman letters, 1768, 1776-82, written as aide-de-camp to George Washington, particularly during the New York and New Jersey campaigns; correspondence between Tench and Anne Willing Francis, 1767-68, with some biographical notes on Tench Francis.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
